title.narrative: Green Growth Action Plan Implementation Support

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to support the Ministry of Environment of Jordan in developing its partnerships with other national stakeholders to take the first steps toward implementing the Green Growth National Action Plan 2021-2025.

The support for implementation wil be acheived by:
1. Acheiving public launch and release of the final edit and designed version of the policy document
2. Supporting the development of a detailed project concept note and funding proposal draft for one or more of the actions listed in the GG-NAP
3. Implementing a program of awareness raising and capacity building about the action plan with national stakeholders

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04532 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: NGGP is mainstreamed into sectoral planning process for each of the 6 NGGP sectors through 2030

description.narrative: 1. Notice of approval from the Cabinet / PM to be sent to the MoENV 2. Implementation agreements received in formal letters from line ministries to MOPIC/MoEnv 3. Donor coordination mechanism established

title.narrative: # of donor coordination meetings held in annually.
# of line ministries indicating they have green growth projects from the GG-NAP in their top priorities or budget annually
GGNAP and M&E framework is discussed and approved by Cabinet as a result of GGGI’s support
Green Growth is mainstreamed into the national planning framework at all levels
The next national vision would include green growth as a main pillar for development in the green economy's sectors (energy, water, waste, tourism, transport and Agri)
At least one green growth project proposal from the GG-NAP (up to USD10M) developed and submitted for financing.

description.narrative: • Notification from MoENV to GGGI indicating the names of nominated participants in the capacity building program • Proof of submission for the projects short list (email) • Proposal’s proof of submission (email or reference number) • Attendance records for capacity building program - Notes from discussions with partners on the project proposal

title.narrative: # of GG-NAP projects developed into a proposals by hybrid project team
# of Green Growth Capacity Building Programs Designed for Green Growth Focal Points and Ministry of Environment Stakeholders
# of capacity building sessions held
# of training delivered on how to use the Green Growth Action Implementation Tracking System
Jordan’s ability to produce quality green growth finance proposals increased

description.narrative: • Proof of submission of proposal (email or applications’ reference number) • Scores on pre- and post-training surveys

title.narrative: % of attendees successfully complete the training, defined as:
Number of funding proposal submitted to a financier as a result of GGGI’s support
attend at least 70% of sessions
complete final presentation
receive at least 70% score on post-test

Implementation arrangements for the Green Growth National Action Plan (GG-NAP) 2021-2025 developed. This includes: - Publishing the cabinet-approved GG-NAP - Securing commitments to implement from line ministries in cooperation with the Ministry of Planning and International Cooperation - Establishing a donor coordination mechanism for the Ministry of Environment to ensure donor resources are channeled to key green growth priorities.

description.narrative: • The final designed and edited document • Proof of publication (website). • Minutes of meetings with line ministries

title.narrative: # of Donor Coordination Meetings Held by year-end
# of meetings held with relevant officials at ministry level to discuss and negotiate inclusion of priority actions in EDP/budget
GGNAP is launched - in a large event - and published after its approval by the Cabinet
Green Growth, Climate Change and Sustainable Development Donor Map developed in coordination with Ministry of Environment
Multi-directorate green growth, climate and sustainable development donor coordination mechanism established by the Secretary General's office in the Ministry of Environment
